section.title: planner codes creating new Planner Code
section.para: To create a new Planner Code, select the NEW button. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: Create your Planner Codes using a logical, hierarchical structure. This will make it easier to retrieve Planner Code information in the future.

section.para: When creating a new Planner Code, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter a code to identify the Planner Code.
Enter a brief description of the Planner Code.

note.para: If you want requirements to be created for Planned Work Orders, the option "Automatically Explode Planned Orders" must be selected. If not selected, Planned Work Orders will not be exploded. This means that Planned Orders for lower level material requirements will not be generated when MRP is run.

listitem.para: Select one of the following if you want Planned Work Orders to be exploded automatically:
This option specifies that when Planned Work Orders are exploded, requirements should be created for the parent Planned Work Order only.
This option specifies that requirements should be created for both parent and child Planned Work Orders.

note.para: If you"re running MRP by Planner Code, the explosion level setting may not make a difference—depending on how your Planner Codes are assigned. For example, if all your Items fall within the same Planner Code, Planned Orders will be generated for all levels of requirements—regardless of whether single or multiple level explosion is set. The same does not hold true when running MRP by Item.
